Key: (Tonomachi invited me out after school.)
So, where are you taking me?

Oh, come on... What's the rush? You're
going to have a great time, Itsuka.
(He wouldn't tell me.)

Lately, you've become real popular, so
it's hard to have some of you for myself!
What, so now you're punishing me for it?!
What happens if I don't put it aside...?
Well―
(Just as Tonomachi was about to respond.)
Hey, hey, Shido-kuuuun. How are ya?\nYou're done with class, right?
H-Hello...
Yeah. We just finished. What's up, you two?
U-Um. We were.. waiting for you, Shido-san.
Yeah. Yoshino kept saying she wanted to\nsee you. I'm almost worried because she said\nshe doesn't even care if there are strangers!
I-I'm fine. I'm happy I ran into you.
I-I see.
Itsuka?

(I felt an aura piercing me from behind, and
I spun around to see Tonomachi glaring at me.)
Tonomachi, take it easy. Just listen―

Shut up! Forget about you, Itsuka! I'd rather
get kicked by a horse than stick around here.
WAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!
Tonomachi!
Oh. Did we interrupt something? Good grief.\nSorry, Shido-kun.
Yes, you did.
It's okay.

It's been a while since I hung out with
Tonomachi.
I-I'm sorry for getting in the way.

(Oh, crap. I'm basically implying that they
were a nuisance.)

I should have thought it through. You have
your own life...
No guy likes girls who nag. At least that's\nwhat my sources tell me.
*whimper*...

Oh, sorry. I never meant to make you think
that you were bothering me.

(I kinda feel bad for Tonomachi, too.
I'll call him later and apologize.)
Shido-kun, don't tell me Tonomachi-kun\nis more important than Yoshino to you.
...What?!

NO NO! Of course not! It's more like I haven't
been able to spend time with Tonomachi lately."	
Message	Yoshinon	So it's true..."
You are...
H-Hey, don't put words in my mouth!

(Hanging out with Tonomachi even for
five minutes invites a load of trouble.)
No, I think we're fine.
Are you sure...?
Yeah. So anyways, what can I do for you?

Is it wrong of me to want to see you...?
Even if I have no particular reason?
Not at all...
I'm so glad...
With that said, I pity the guy who ran off\nand all, but how about the three of us find\nsomething fun to do?
Yeah, sure. You waited for me after all.

(Guess I'll have to call up Tonomachi and
apologize later. Nah, no need.)

Anyways, did you have somewhere in mind,
Yoshino? We could watch a movie or maybe
stop by the video store.

Oh, um... I could just ask... and movies will
be provided for me.
They're so generous. Talk about having friends\nin your corner!

Well, if Ratatoskr can build you a whole
apartment, sending you some movies isn't
a problem.

Anyways, we don't need to waste time standing
here. Let's go.

(I'm sure they waited for me all day, so
I bet they're tired.)
Oh, um... I'll leave it to you.
I think it'd be best to go somewhere where\nyou can relax.
Right.

(I decided to take Yoshino to a restaurant
that Kotori and I had been to before.)
U-Um. Do you come here often... Shido-san?
Hm? I mean, sometimes...
But you wouldn't come here alone, right?

Well, I take Kotori here sometimes. Come
to think of it, I never come here alone.
I see. Guess they don't call it a family\nrestaurant for nothing.
Well, when I'm by myself. I eat random junk.
I see...
But there's an implication when you call it\na 'family' restaurant, don't you think?
What do you mean?
Don't think you should bring your 'family'\nto a 'family restaurant'?

Wh-Whaaaa? Yoshino, then that would
mean... Shido-san and I...

Ahahaha. Well, um, I think it just means
a cozy atmosphere.
A-And... Kotori-san is...
Kotori's my little sister, so she is family.
I mean, sure. But doesn't the thought\ncross your mind whenever you bring\ngirls here?

About that.... Family restaurants aren't exactly
a romantic getaway.
Oh, no? So you're admitting you didn't\ngo all out for Yoshino?
U-Um, it doesn't bother me...
H-Hey, we just came here to eat.
Hahaha. Sorry, sorry. I'm just teasing you.

Some time soon, I want to take you to a fancier
place, but...

But...? Oh, um, I'm sorry. It's hard to go there
because of me, isn't it...

No, that's not what I mean. I just don't really
go on fancy dates, you know?
R-Really?
Whaaat? You're always surrounded by\nwomen. Don't tell me you can't think of\none place.
This is all a misunderstanding!

(Besides, it's not my fault I've never been
on a fancy date.)
Hehehe... Shido-san, is that true?

Yup. Just another reason I'll nothing more
than a headache...
I want to... experience new things with you.
R-Right...
(My and Yoshino's eyes locked.)
Woohoo! You guys make me jealous.\nWhat cuties.

S-Stop mocking us. A-Anyways, what are
you going to order?
U-um...
Shido-kun, any recommendations?

Hm. They're doing a dessert fair, so how
about this parfait?
Hmm. A seasonal fruit fair, huh? Sounds\ndelicious. Want this one, Yoshino?
Oh, um... Uh, what about you, Shido-san?
I... Hm. I'm fine with fruit juice.
Then you can ask Yoshino for a bite of\nher parfait. Have her feed you. Whaddya say?
...I'm okay, but thanks.
Oh. Come on. If you ordered a parfait too,\nthen you can't use the same spoon?
Uh...
Um. Could I request some coffee?

Huh? Oh, sorry. Were you not into the
parfait?
Oh, no. I'm sorry... I just wanted some coffee.
You're not sick, are you?
I don't think so. I think she's trying to\nbe more mature.
Y-Yoshinon, um... Please don't...

Hm? Oh, well. If you want coffee, that's fine.
I get it. Sometimes you just crave it.
Y-Yes... I want some... coffee...
But you used to say how you disliked it\nbecause it was so bitter. I think you're\ntrying too hard, Yoshinoooooo.
...Yoshinon!

Hahaha. Maybe you have a point. Yoshino
does enjoy sweets...

I-I, too, enjoy coffee... I can handle bitter
things.

When I was younger, I never got why people
drank the stuff. But before I knew it, I was
hooked.
R-Right. Coffee is... delicious.

(It felt like something was off, but I called
our waitress over to take our order.)

Yoshino, are you sure you don't want milk
or sugar?
I-I don't need it.
Oh, look at you. It's pretty bitter. Maybe\neven a little sour. Adding milk might make\nit more bearable.
Yoshinon, Yoshino said she would drink it.
Hahahaha. Okay, okay. But don't tell you I\ndidn't warn you if you hate it. Right Shido-kun?

Hmm. Well, I don't think you have to force
yourself. Drink it whichever way you want.
Shido-san, how... do you like your coffee?

Well, if I'm sleepy, I take it black.
But I also like a good café au lait, too.
So you don't always drink it black?
Well, I can only handle so much bitterness.
HAHAHAHA! Shido-kun, I wish you could\nbe a real man and say you liked it bla―

Hahaha. I guess drinking it black is a true
sign of maturity, huh?
M-Maturity, yes.

(Yoshino sipped her coffee, but I saw a
hint of reservation. I couldn't help from
looking at her.)

(To make matters worse, her other hand held
Yoshinon, making her shake even more.)
...HOT!
A-Are you okay?

(Yoshino was shocked by the temperature,
causing her hand to slip.)

(I hastily reached for a napkin to wipe
the spilled coffee.)
O-Oh, Shido-san...
Yoshino, you okay?
U-Um, I'm fine...
No, you're not. You need to be careful.
I-I'm sorry.
Looks like you didn't get any on your\nclothes, but there's coffee on your legs.

(I looked at Yoshino's thigh, and threw
some napkins there.)
Oh, this is―
Oh, no no. You were trying to help Yoshino,\nright? I know it wasn't a lewd act. Shido-kun,\nyou're seriously such a―

Wh-What are you on about?! Oh, your
skin is a little pink.
I-It... stings a bit...
Maybe some ice would help...

(I wiped the spilled coffee, but now the
napkin was soaked.)
U-Um, Shido-san... I'm fine.

You shouldn't take burns lightly. Hang
on a moment.

(I scooped some ice out of the water and
put in on Yoshino's reddened thigh.)

Aah... O-Ooh... Shido-san... Th-That... Mm...
Aah... Faaaah!

It might become a burn later, so bear with me
for a bit.
B-But... That's cold... Ah... Fa...mm...
Shido, quick thinking. Yoshino, just grin and\nbear it. Otherwise it'll leave a scar.

Okay... I-I'll endure it... Mmmf... Hah...
*grunt*... Aah... *pant*... Mm...
Sorry. Just hang in there for me.
You're apologizing, but am I hearing a\ntouch of satisfaction from you hearing Yoshino\nmoan like this?

U-Um, Yoshinon. This isn't the time for that.
Yoshino, does it still hurt?
Um, it tickles... I can't tell anymore...
If you're fine, then I'm fine.

(I took off the ice cube, and a sense of relief
came over Yoshino. I used a napkin to dry
her skin.)
Fua... U-Um, Shido-san...?

Well, your clothes might get wet. We need
to wipe the moisture.
You say that, but it's a slippery slope. I get\nit though. You're taking advantage of the\nsituation for a little contact, right?
Hey, I told you. That's not what's going on―
Mmm? You don't want to hurt Yoshino's\nfeelings, do you?
That's not what I'm saying either!

Th-Then, if we're not in front of people...
You would...?
Y-Yoshino?
Oh, um... I'm sorry. It's nothing.
Oh, um... Gotcha.
But Yoshino, drinking coffee black for the\nfirst time led to Shido-kun patting your leg\ndry.

Forget what Yoshinon's saying. Anyways,
why did you order coffee, Yoshino? I thought
it's what you wanted.

W-Well, I thought, it would be a mature
choice...
Oh, is that why?
Don't... tease me for my reason.

Sorry. I just mean you shouldn't have to force
yourself to do anything. Adults can eat parfaits,
can't they?
Yeah, totally. You can be tough and enjoy\nsweet things at the same time. Gosh...
...Right.

Don't force yourself. You're entitled to eat
whatever you want.

Um, but...! Sh-Shido-san, are you okay with
that?
Of course! It's not like I'm your boss.

(Yoshino pursed her lips, suddenly deep in
thought.)

(I looked at Yoshino, but the puppet only
smiled back at me, silent for once in her
life.)
